data.title: Tom Ford Trauma & The Harris Bear Case

Pitaro’s Dream Venu, Mar-a-Lago Factionalism, Music Industry Shudders Welcome back to The Daily Courant, your afternoon missive from Puck HQ. First up today, Lauren Sherman pulls back the curtain […]
data.text:
Welcome back to The Daily Courant, your afternoon missive from Puck HQ.

First up today, Lauren Sherman pulls back the curtain on what really preceded Peter Hawkings’ sudden ouster as Tom Ford’s creative director. Was it the “Vanilla Sex” non-scandal scandal? Penny-pinching overlords? Or was it simply that Hawkings, despite all his considerable talent, isn’t Tom Ford?

Plus, below the fold: John Ourand gets the MoffettNathanson view of Zaz’s NBA rights imbroglio, the NFL’s CBS deal, Venu’s nine-year event horizon, and more. Peter Hamby punctures the Democrats’ Kamala Harris sugar high. Scott Mendelson hunts for signs of life in the ’24 box office. On Somebody’s Gotta Win, Tara Palmeri is joined by CNN’s Kasie Hunt to delineate the growing factions within the Trump campaign. On The Town, Matt Belloni and Lucas Shaw debate whether the music industry has actually peaked. And on The Powers That Be, Julia Ioffe rings up Peter to reveal the Blob anxieties regarding a wider war in the Middle East, before unpacking the most complex prisoner exchange since the Cold War.

11 Emmy® Nominations including

Outstanding Limited Series

–

[WATCH] The Emmy® Nominated Cast

Respond to Fan Reactions

Emmy® Nominees Richard Gadd, Jessica Gunning, and Nava Mau discuss the impact the show has had on their lives, and pop culture.

[WATCH] Emmy® Nominee Jessica Gunning

Breaks Down Her Captivating Performance

Writer & Lead Actor Richard Gadd and Supporting Actress Nava Mau discuss the incredible and nuanced performance of Supporting Actress Jessica Gunning as "Martha" in Baby Reindeer.

[WATCH] First-Time Emmy® Nominee Richard Gadd's

Incredible Writing and Performance

Emmy® Nominated Supporting Actresses Jessica Gunning and Nava Mau discuss the breathtaking writing in Baby Reindeer, as well as Richard Gadd's terrific performance.

–

For more on Baby Reindeer, visit series.netflixawards.com

Matt is joined by Bloomberg’s Lucas Shaw to discuss whether it's time to panic for the music industry after shares of Universal Music Group tanked due to a deceleration in streaming subscription revenue growth. They debate whether this is a crisis or just a blip, and offer up ways music streamers should differentiate themselves to make more money and get back on the path of accelerated growth.
